content.description: This route starts right of "The Eggman". Locate a left hand pocket off the ground that leads to an obvious knob, a hidden divit for the next left hand hold on a sloping rail will get you situated squarely on the route.Another crux to, with multiple paths, to gain the 3rd bolt leads to more thoughtful climbing.

Clip the first bolt from atop a large boulder and surmount the overhang. Trend diagonally left to the 3rd bolt, entering excellent face climbing on nobs and very nice sandstone panels. Good rests between harder sections and fun crimp bashing up higher.
content.location: Last route on the left side of the Undercut Wall, before the Refuge, starting amongst large boulders.

content.description: Sustained, short hand traverse between bolts midway, cool pocket-undercling-pinch finish

content.location: First bolted line on the traverse just right of two trees

content.description: Tough overhanging no feet start to crimpy sustained sequences

Start off of a large boulder with no feet on a jug to the first bolt and a slot, stick-clip. After the 2nd bolt of Lone Brave step right and enjoy very nice face climbing past nobs and small crimps through a tricky hand and finger crack at a small roof (alpine draw handy here to keep rope out of crack). A brief moderate section leads to more sequential climbing up a vertical wall to the anchors. Enjoyable, sustained climbing with well protected cruxes.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Fixed steel lower off anchor.
content.location: This route shares a start with 'Lone Brave'. Left of 'Eggman'.

content.description: Left of the two trees, starts on a bucket jug that leads to sustained excellent vertical climbing.
Dirty low but good clean 10a climbing on upper portion over green lichen to pocket finish
content.location: 3rd route on traverse, shares anchors with One Shot

content.description: Welcome to the Daiye Spa: Say hello to a natural feeling. Taste the breeze. Adore your sparkle. Wave goodbye to your earthly worries. Take flight above the Osage. ~Shares first few  moves of body message. Hand traverse rightward on the bottom of the hole, climb to a good stance and bust a v7/8 to the lip. Great rock (with the exception of the first few holds), nice moves and a nails boulder at the top of the wall.
content.location: Right of Body Message. Rightward trending for the first few bolts, then straight up the wall to a gently overhanging blank section of black sandstone.

content.description: Who wants a body message? - Do a couple sandy moves off the ground to gain the hole. Bust a boulder problem out of the hole and flow on black slopes and edges to a high crux.
content.location: Climbs through the large hole in the middle of the undercut wall.

content.description: The area encountered after the "Burns Side", marked by a consistent 7 foot roof over the path with mostly vertical climbing further above.
